alert.note: Alert for Admiralty Inlet Area; Central Coast; Eastern Strait of Juan de Fuca; North Coast; San Juan County; Western Strait of Juan De Fuca (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 15 at 11:24AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTH AND CENTRAL WASHINGTON COAST, STRAIT OF JUAN DE FUCA COAST, AND SAN JUAN ISLANDS... ...TSUNAMI ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTH AND CENTRAL WASHINGTON COAST, STRAIT OF JUAN DE FUCA COAST, AND SAN JUAN ISLANDS... * UPDATES... Observed tsunami wave heights from this morning have been added. * LOCAL IMPACTS... A tsunami capable of producing strong currents that may be hazardous to swimmers, boats, and coastal structures is occuring. Widespread inundation is NOT expected. * RECOMMENDED ACTIONS... If you are located in this coastal area, move off the beach and out of harbors and marinas. Do not go to the coast to watch the tsunami. Be alert to instructions from your local emergency officials Tsunamis often arrive as a series of waves or surges which could be dangerous for many hours after the first wave arrival. The first tsunami wave or surge may not be the highest in the series. * FORECAST TSUNAMI DURATION... The largest waves are expected to continue for several hours. * FORECAST PEAK TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS... One to three feet. * OBSERVED TSUNAMI WAVE HEIGHTS FROM EARLIER... Neah Bay, WA 0.4 ft / 12 cm La Push, WA 1.1 ft / 34 cm Westport, WA 0.5 ft / 15 cm * PRELIMINARY EARTHQUAKE INFORMATION... An underwater volcanic eruption occurred at 827 PM PST on Jan 14 2022, centered near the Tonga Islands This product will be updated as new information becomes available. Stay tuned to your local news source and NOAA weather radio for further information and updates.
